sentence.text: In tears Shamlou had croaked : ` I hear you , Darvish Hamman . "
` No , definitely not here , Sergeant , " he croaked .
` Call the newspapers , " she croaked , ` I 've just broken every bloody speed record in swimming .
` Do n't speak to me ! " she croaked hoarsely .
` I warn you , major , " he croaked , and had to clear his throat .
` Thank you , " I croaked , throat dry .
` Let me go ! " she croaked desperately .
` Do n't lie , man ! " croaked Lady Merchiston .
` Ladies and gentlemen , " croaked the adjudicator in a strangled voice , ` the end is near and we must face the final curtain . "
` I missed that , " croaked the landlord .
Really frightened , then , she tried to sit up , croaking his name .
The man croaked a few hardly comprehensible syllables .
A look of relief passed over his own face when , the dreadful malaise gone , she croaked at him , ` Oh , dear , what happened ? "
When Gifford Tate was alive and used to visit him , Tate had croaked through his beard : ` Why the hell do n't you get yourself a decent studio , Eddie ?
“ Mother … ” he croaked in a broken voice .
` Get out ! " she managed to croak , bringing up both hands , ineffectually shielding herself from his assault .
